Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice with part of handle; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white lines; exterior: above handle, part of undetermined decoration, possibly a foreleg; black on handle root; below, traces of two black bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The thickness and size of the sherd suggest that the vase was a heavy chalice The sherd joins British Museum 1965,0930.169 and 1965,0930.40 (which preserves the handle root to the left). 1965,0930.19 and 171 are probably from the same chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1613) (phase 2)
